result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael W. Winkler Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentional.Cause Great Harm, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael W. Winkler in court with attorney Roberta Ann Heckes. Both appear telephonically -Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:35  
Motion to w/draw filed by Atty Heckes - Court statement - wants to make sure appropriate Coloquay is done  Ms Heckes statement - not in agreement as far as where case could proceed - Defendant statement - wants another PD - Court statement - will not have another PD appointed- - Court reads on waiver of counsel /discharge of appellate counsel- Right to appeal -  Defendant gives statement regarding sentencing- reports. investigation was not done thouroughly, sentenced was only based on prior offense - Court statement -  continues questioning of waiver- statement - Defendant further questions Ms Heckes and Court- Ms Heckes explains procedure to Mr Winkler regarding no merit objection and requests for extension -Court further explains waiver to Defendant - Defendant statement- Would like Ms Heckes to stay on and file the no merit report  - HEckes statement - Court statement - Ms Heckes will remain on case at this time- and will resubmit order denying motion -

records.addlTxt:
9:33 a.m. Defendant Michael W. Winkler in court with attorney Sharon Mae Gisselman.  Special Prosecutor Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties in receipt of PSI and sentencing memorandums. Gisselman - statement that defendant's health conditions have not improved - has several upcoming medical appointments - defendant statement -came to Court unmedicated however is in a lot of pain. Gisselman - clarification to PSI - counseling was for 7 or 8 years. Side bar. Court addresses issue of closed hearing and Defendant's right to open hearing - Court cautions media regarding identity of victim - Ben Meyer statement to only recording audio - will not release identity of victim. Victim, R.M., statement to court/Michlig questions victim/Gisselman questions victim. Court notes clarification to PSI - wrong maximum is indicated for Charge is Class C felony. Wrong maximum is also indicated on 1st sheet of plea questionnaire - typed agreement attached to plea questionnaire has correct information as to maximums. Michlig statement that penalties must be as in 1995 - determinate amount of time must be sentence - no extended supervision is allowed as indicated in PSI. Gisselman in agreement. Michlig statement to sentencing. Gisselman statement to sentencing. Defendant statement on sentencing. Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
Prison -  10 years
Remand immediately
Credit - time served (will be stipulated by parties)
Not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Substance Abuse Program. 
Appeal rights given. NADVI given. WEDS given.
Adj. 11:23 a.m.
on Sentencing - includes cover letter
from Defense attorney (note that faxed copy is scanned, but text is unreadable)
Steven Michlig
Sentencing hearing on September 23, 2016 at 09:00 am.
State's Exh. 1 - Officer Report/sealed per Judge O'Melia
Sentencing hearing on August 3, 2016 at 10:30 am.

11:12 a.m. Defendant Michael W. Winkler in court with attorney Sharon Mae Gisselman. Steven Mitchell Michlig, Special Prosecutor, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information filed. Michlig statement to agreement/resolution--act occurred prior to truth & sentencing/State has agreed not to charge defendant of other alleged acts/victims J.K.,C.K.,E.J.,T.D.,A.D.,J.C.,K.C.,S.O.,S.L./S.B., and M.W. State requests Presentence Investigation. Gisselman in receipt of Amended Information/reads waiving. Defendant enters no contest/Alford plea. Winkler statement. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Winkler statement. Court explains Alford plea to defendant. Court finds waiver free and voluntary. State's Exh. 1 (Report of Officer) marked, offered, received. Court finds strong evidence of guilt as to original charge and strong evidence of guilt regarding amended charge; finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty of amended charge. Court orders presentence investigation.  Court advises defendant he does not have to abide by PSI recommendation. Michlig statement, references s. 939.74(2)(c). Gisselman statement as to defendant's ongoing medical issues/scheduling. Winkler statement. Court will not interfere with currently scheduled appointments. Counsel to get sentencing date from JA. 11:43 a.m. adj.
letter re medical appointment-includes fax cover sheet
No contact/no communication whatsoever with E.J.

8:54 a.m. Attorney Sharon Mae Gisselman in court, by phone, with leave of Court. Defendant Michael Winkler does not appear. Steven Mitchell Michlig, Special Prosecutor, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court statement--Gisselman notified Court that Winkler unavailable for plea today. Court received fax confirming appointment. Court questions Gisselman regarding appointment. Gisselman speaks to Winkler's medical issues. Michlig statement--speaks to defendant's health issues/non-appearace; requests bail be revoked. Gisselman statement. Court authorizes warrant. Michlig requests bond modification. Court modifies bond--orders defendant have no contact with E.J./no communication whatsoever.
confirmation from Atty Gissleman that trial is off
of Habeus Corpus Ad Testificandum and Order to Sheriff/Warden
From Denise in DA's office, cancel JT and schedule plea on 5/17/16 @ 8:30 a.m.

8:36 a.m. Attorney Sharon Mae Gisselman in court appearing telephonically with leave of court.  Defendant not present. Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Richard Moore appearing telephonically with leave of court. Michlig sent written proposal for plea agreement. Gisselman statement that proposal will most likely be accepted with some reservations as to arguing sentence, health issues and competency. Court statement to Miranda/Goodchild issues.  Court finds no issues with Miranda - defendant was free to leave or ask officers to leave; finds interviews reasonable. Goodchild - Court finds statements were voluntary. Court statement to Other Acts Evidence - Court will allow 4th victim (E.W.), 10th victim (S.O.), victim in this case (R.M.) and 3rd victim (E.J.). Michlig statement to Prior Convictions motion - Court has not considered motion. If necessary, will rule prior to trial. Michlig statement to writ for victim to be brought to Oneida County-Court will sign writ. Michlig statement to Defendant's responsibility for Defense to inform Clerk by May 12, 2016 if jury is needed-Court instructs Gisselman to contact Clerk with need for jury by May 12, 2016. Court confirms with Attorney Gisselman that medical procesdures for defendant are not elective procedures - Gisselman confirms. Adj. 9:10 a.m.
Written summary of subject matter to which expert witness will testify

Case not called on record. Defendant Michael W. Winkler in court with attorney Sharon Mae Gisselman.  Special Prosecutor Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Oral ruling on motions scheduled for May 6, 2016 at 08:30 a.m. Attorney Gisselman may appear by telephone.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.
in Opposition to Motion to Admit Other Acts Evidence & in support of Motion to Suppress
Exhibits 1 & 2 (USB Flash drive & DVD) from 4/5/16 motion hearing in Judge O'Melia's possession for review
from Corp. Counsel regarding Quit Claim Deed/Bail - Correction Instrument
In Support of Other Acts Evidence-- original retained in illegible originals drawer
State's Reply to Discovery continued
in Opposition to Defendant's Motion to Suppress - includes cover letter
3- Exhibit 1 not scannable - both exhibits stored in Exhibit file
from motion hearing
Final pre-trial on May 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.

9:14 a.m. Defendant Michael W. Winkler in court with attorney Sharon Mae Gisselman.  Special Prosecutor Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Miranda/Goodchild issue - State calls Rhinelander Police Department Detective Joshua Chiamulera/sworn/direct by Michlig/ witness ID's defendant /cross by Gisselman/redirect by Michlig - State's Exhibit 1 - USB Flash drive of recorded interview - marked, Court questions State/witness regarding content of USB flash drive and transcript of audio - Chiamulera states he believes USB drive contains both audio and video  - Exhibit 1 received. Exhibit 2 - DVD of phone interview marked - withdrawn - Gisselman recross. Court exam of witness. State's Exhibit 3 - pages 5 -  9 of police report which summarizes interview - marked. 
Motion for Other Acts Evidence - Michlig statement to documents filed. Gisselman statement. Court - prior convictions are different than  other acts evidence - Michlig statement to motions for other acts evidence. 
State's overview of victims - Michlig/Gisselman statements. Court declines to rule until actual evidence is presented re other victims. State is requesting ability to cross exam defendant if he testifies regarding other victims - Gisselman statement. 
10:32 a.m. - Defendant is excused from court room due to physical problems - no more evidence is to be presented today.
10:35 a.m. - Off record discussion held. 
On record - 10:48 am. 
Court is requesting briefs to be filed on all issues. Briefs to be filed - State's brief due April 15, 2016 ; Defense brief due -April 29, 2016. Court questions Gisselman re defendant's surgery schedule. Court will not modify jury trial date at this time. Final pre-trial date to be obtained by counsel from JA - Jury Instructions to be presented at pre-trial - Motions in Limine to be filed 7 days prior to pre-trial date.
Bail continued. 
Adj. 10:51 a.m.
Motion hearing at 04-05-2016 09:00 am
- includes cover letter
States Reply to Discovery
Quit Claim Deed for property bond - original in safe in COC's office
Defendant has signed Quit Claim Deed of property to Oneida County - see attached
Lien search kept on left side of file/waiting for deed in order to process property bond
States Reply to Discovery
and Order to Modify Bond  - includes cover letter
in support of Admission of Other Acts Evidence

10:54 a.m. Defendant Michael W. Winkler in court with attorney Sharon Mae Gisselman.  Defendant Michael W. Winkler in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Michlig statement - based on information exchanged additional discovery and investigation  is necessary. Gisselman statement. Court questions date of transcript attached to Motion to Admit Other Acts - transcript is from interview in summer of 2015. Court questions State regarding other acts motion/witnesses filed yesterday - Michlig statement - State would like clarification of whether evidence would be allowed prior to contacting other witnesses/victims of prior acts. State moves - If defendant testifies to ask questions and follow-up on cross exam with various acts as outlined in motions - in regard to Emily - that evidence would come in whether defendant testifies or not. Michlig/Gisselman request adjournment for additional discovery. Court finds if any victim statements exist in any form (police report, etc.) they must be provided to defense. Motion hearing is adjourned. Discovery to be completed within 30 days. Gisselman motion to furlough privileges to attend to medical problems, length of furlough to be determined by doctor, not sure if surgery is necessary. Defendant statement to medical issues, furlough, evidence to be presented at trial, need to be out of jail to contact witnesses, reduction in bail. Michlig statement to motion for furlough/modification of bond. Defendant statement to medical issues. Court instructs Gisselman to investigate issue of real property to be posted in lieu of cash bond - Court puts furlough motion on hold until response from Gisselman. Adj. 11:32 a.m.  Jury trial scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
States Reply to Discovery
States Reply to Discovery
to Modify Bond (Second)  - includes cover letter
States Reply to Discovery
attached to Motion to Admit Other Acts Evidence
to Admit Other Acts Evidence Pursuant to 904.04(2)(b), Wis. Stats.
to Admit Other Acts Evidence Pursuant to 904.04(2)(b)2, Wis. Stats.
States Reply to Discovery

3:16 p.m. Defendant Michael W. Winkler in court with attorney Sharon Mae Gisselman.  Defendant Michael W. Winkler in custody.  Steven MIchlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Michlig statement to negotiations. Michlig/Gisselman statements to motion to modify bond. Gisselman states received discovery today. Michlig states need date for jury trial. Motions in Limine to be filed by December 23, 2015 along with proposed listing of jury instruction numbers.  If any instructions need to be modified - then entire instruction to be filed by December 23, 2015 - Court denies motion to modify bond. Defendant questions Court/Michlig as to prejudice from prior acts and relationships to Richard Moore. Court states Defendant should consult with his attorney concerning any conflict of interest. Defendant moves to dismiss action - needs to be out of jail because needs to find witnesses, constitutional rights are being taken away - can't contact attorney except by telephone because she is in Wausau. Court states not valid considerations to modify bond and motion to modify bail has been denied. Adj. 3:39 p.m.  Jury trial scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 10:30 am.
- includes cover letter

11:21 a.m. Defendant Michael W. Winkler in court, in custody, with attorney Sharon Mae Gisselman.  Defendant Michael W. Winkler in custody.  Stephen M. Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Michlig states no agreement reached-discovery has not been completed - meaningful discussions toward resolution have taken place.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

2:55 p.m. Defendant Michael W. Winkler in court, in custody, with attorney Sharon Mae Gisselman.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Court statement. Gisselman statement--assuming same charges, defendant pleads not guilty. If after filing of Information there are any changes, Court advises Gisselman can file objection w/in 15 days. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 11:00 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

11:09 a.m. Defendant Michael W. Winkler in court, via video, with attorney Sharon Mae Gisselman.  Defendant Michael W. Winkler in custody.  Steven M. Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived. Defendant statements to issues regarding arrest and need to confer with attorney. Gisselman/Michlig statement to motion to modify bond. Court adjourns motion on bond to August 20, 2015.
Bail continued.
Adj. 11:18 am  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond
Adjourned initial appearance at 08-12-2015 11:00 am
Per J.A. - defendant is eligible for PD but one is not available for today.

03:32 pm - Defendant Michael W. Winkler in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Winkler states was going to retain Bennett - Bennett unable to represent.  Winkler motion to modify bond - requesting sig bond.  Defendant states needs to have surgery.  Court denies motion at this time.  Defendant requests dismissal of charges.  Court denies.  Court adjourns for defendant to obtain counsel.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 11:00 a.m.  Adjourned 03:42 p.m.
no contact w/R.J.M.

01:26 pm - Defendant Michael W. Winkler in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will obtain counsel,  Michlig/Defendant statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
